2023 年 12 月 11 日星期一 08:09:39 +0000每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks TED - TED.com TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到一些世界领先的思想家和实干家在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲，激发、激发和激发他们的想象力。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 TED 会议上值得传播的想法泰德TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到一些世界领先的思想家和实干家在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲，激发、激发和激发他们的想象力。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 zh知识共享：https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/泰德contact@ted.com https://pl.tedcdn.com/rss_feed_images/ted_talks_main_podcast/video.png每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks 144 144 科学技术娱乐设计 TED、TEDTalks、TED 演讲、灵感、创造力、技术演示、教育不非成人的
压力如何耗尽你的大脑——以及如何应对？妮可·拜尔斯妮可·拜尔斯Do you ever feel extra forgetful? Stress could be the culprit. In a fascinating talk about how your memory works, neuropsychologist Nicole Byers shares the science behind how stress drains your brain's resources, making it harder to remember things and easier to make mistakes. But fear not: she also shares a simple solution to recharge your brain and get your memory back on track.压力如何耗尽你的大脑——以及如何应对？妮可·拜尔斯Do you ever feel extra forgetful? Stress could be the culprit. In a fascinating talk about how your memory works, neuropsychologist Nicole Byers shares the science behind how stress drains your brain's resources, making it harder to remember things and easier to make mistakes. But fear not: she also shares a simple solution to recharge your brain and get your memory back on track. https://www.ted.com/talks/nicole_byers_how_stress_drains_your_brain_and_what_to_do_about_it?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:121936 121936 Fri, 08 Dec 2023 16:07:49 +0000高等教育不00:09:03泰德
为什么科学需要支持自然医学|陈杰夫陈杰夫Pharmaceutical companies often only patent drugs they can monetize, creating synthetic versions of remedies already available in nature. In this quick talk, physician and entrepreneur Jeff Chen offers a path to affordable, effective natural medicines — for everyone.为什么科学需要支持自然医学|陈杰夫Pharmaceutical companies often only patent drugs they can monetize, creating synthetic versions of remedies already available in nature. In this quick talk, physician and entrepreneur Jeff Chen offers a path to affordable, effective natural medicines — for everyone. https://www.ted.com/talks/jeff_chen_why_science_needs_to_get_behind_natural_medicine?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120177 120177 Fri, 08 Dec 2023 16:00:20 +0000高等教育不00:03:37泰德
恩典的统一力量|肖恩·古德肖恩·古德"Will you forgive me?" asks community leader Sean Goode. He proposes that the promise of forgiveness before wrongdoing — what he calls "unapologetic grace" — can empower people to share their truths and create space to bridge our differences.恩典的统一力量|肖恩·古德"Will you forgive me?" asks community leader Sean Goode. He proposes that the promise of forgiveness before wrongdoing — what he calls "unapologetic grace" — can empower people to share their truths and create space to bridge our differences. https://www.ted.com/talks/sean_goode_the_unifying_power_of_grace?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120454 120454 Fri, 08 Dec 2023 15:58:50 +0000高等教育不00:03:38泰德
干细胞如何协调愈合以及如何加速愈合 |凯文·斯通凯文·斯通From synthetic embryos to lab-grown skin, we live in a brave new world of stem cell advances. So why can it still take years to recover from injury? Orthopedic surgeon Kevin Stone is working to accelerate the body's healing response so you could recover in a matter of days or weeks, not months or years.干细胞如何协调愈合以及如何加速愈合 |凯文·斯通From synthetic embryos to lab-grown skin, we live in a brave new world of stem cell advances. So why can it still take years to recover from injury? Orthopedic surgeon Kevin Stone is working to accelerate the body's healing response so you could recover in a matter of days or weeks, not months or years. https://www.ted.com/talks/kevin_stone_how_stem_cells_orchestrate_healing_and_how_to_speed_it_up?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120293 120293 Fri, 08 Dec 2023 15:55:13 +0000高等教育不00:03:22泰德
修复人体的未来|尼娜·坦登尼娜·坦登As humans live longer than ever before, we need our implants to last as long as we do, says bioengineer Nina Tandon. Using stem cells and digital fabrication, she's working on growing anatomically precise spare parts for the human body, replacing damaged bones, cartilage and more with implants that fit perfectly and hold up for a lifetime.修复人体的未来|尼娜·坦登As humans live longer than ever before, we need our implants to last as long as we do, says bioengineer Nina Tandon. 真爱——以及“从此幸福快乐”的神话|弗朗西斯卡·霍吉弗朗西斯卡·霍吉"The fairytale industrial complex has been lying to you," says love coach and podcast host Francesca Hogi. Having spent years talking to thousands of people about their romantic hopes and dreams, she introduces a new possibility for our collective romantic future, one that recognizes that each of us holds the keys to true love within ourselves.真爱——以及“从此幸福快乐”的神话|弗朗西斯卡·霍吉"The fairytale industrial complex has been lying to you," says love coach and podcast host Francesca Hogi. Having spent years talking to thousands of people about their romantic hopes and dreams, she introduces a new possibility for our collective romantic future, one that recognizes that each of us holds the keys to true love within ourselves. https://www.ted.com/talks/francesca_hogi_true_love_and_the_myth_of_happily_ever_after?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120210 120210 Fri, 08 Dec 2023 15:15:45 +0000高等教育不00:03:28泰德
AGI 的变革潜力——以及它何时到来 |肖恩·莱格和克里斯·安德森肖恩·莱格和克里斯·安德森As the cofounder of Google DeepMind, Shane Legg is driving one of the greatest transformations in history: the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI). He envisions a system with human-like intelligence that would be exponentially smarter than today's AI, with limitless possibilities and applications. In conversation with head of TED Chris Anderson, Legg explores the evolution of AGI, what the world might look like when it arrives — and how to ensure it's built safely and ethically. AGI 的变革潜力——以及它何时到来 |肖恩·莱格和克里斯·安德森As the cofounder of Google DeepMind, Shane Legg is driving one of the greatest transformations in history: the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI). He envisions a system with human-like intelligence that would be exponentially smarter than today's AI, with limitless possibilities and applications. In conversation with head of TED Chris Anderson, Legg explores the evolution of AGI, what the world might look like when it arrives — and how to ensure it's built safely and ethically. https://www.ted.com/talks/shane_legg_and_chris_anderson_the_transformative_pottial_of_agi_and_when_it_might_arrive?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:121113 121113 Thu, 07 Dec 2023 22:02:01 +0000高等教育不00:16:07泰德
AI的单点故障|罗布·托斯罗布·托斯"The world's most important advanced technology is nearly all produced in a single facility," says AI expert Rob Toews. He describes how one company in Taiwan, TSMC, manufactures nearly all the most advanced semiconductor chips — a crucial technology that powers everything from phones to electric vehicles to next-generation artificial intelligence — and breaks down how geopolitical tensions in the region could paralyze the global field of AI. AI的单点故障|罗布·托斯"The world's most important advanced technology is nearly all produced in a single facility," says AI expert Rob Toews. He describes how one company in Taiwan, TSMC, manufactures nearly all the most advanced semiconductor chips — a crucial technology that powers everything from phones to electric vehicles to next-generation artificial intelligence — and breaks down how geopolitical tensions in the region could paralyze the global field of AI. https://www.ted.com/talks/rob_toews_ai_s_single_point_of_failure?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120762 120762 Thu, 07 Dec 2023 19:17:11 +0000高等教育不00:11:30泰德
人工智能能发现医生漏掉的东西吗？ |埃里克·托波尔埃里克·托波尔AI could propel the biggest transformation in the history of medicine, says physician-scientist Eric Topol. He explains how sophisticated AI models can interpret medical images as well or better than human experts can — and, beyond that, even pick up things that human eyes can't see. Learn all the ways AI is poised to make a difference for both patients and doctors.人工智能能发现医生漏掉的东西吗？ |埃里克·托波尔AI could propel the biggest transformation in the history of medicine, says physician-scientist Eric Topol. He explains how sophisticated AI models can interpret medical images as well or better than human experts can — and, beyond that, even pick up things that human eyes can't see. Learn all the ways AI is poised to make a difference for both patients and doctors. https://www.ted.com/talks/eric_topol_can_ai_catch_what_doctors_miss?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120982 120982 Thu, 07 Dec 2023 15:59:24 +0000高等教育不00:14:02泰德
AI时代的营销将会发生什么？ |杰西卡·李艾科杰西卡·李艾科Generative AI is poised to transform the workplace, but we still need human brains for new ideas, says marketing expert Jessica Apotheker. She explores how marketers can find their niche in the world of AI based on their preference for data or creativity, offering a pragmatic and hopeful look at the future of business. 如何在生活的荒谬中找到幽默|迈拉·卡尔曼迈拉·卡尔曼With levity and profound insight, artist Maira Kalman reflects on life, death, dinner parties, not knowing the right answers, the joys of eating a hot dog from a street vendor and more. This talk, interwoven with her delightful paintings, is itself an artwork that seems to hold the entirety of life in all its absurd glory.如何在生活的荒谬中找到幽默|迈拉·卡尔曼With levity and profound insight, artist Maira Kalman reflects on life, death, dinner parties, not knowing the right answers, the joys of eating a hot dog from a street vendor and more.
